Ukrainian UAVs and jet drones attacked the city of Oryol.   4 drones have impacted the Oryol Power Plant, with each striking a different part of the plant, resulting in a wider area of damage. Fires are now burning at the impact sites.   Earlier (yesterday)‚Ä¶

The Ukrainian Navy reports that Neptune cruise missiles were used in the attack on the Oryol Thermal Power Plant yesterday, alongside long-range UAVs and rocket drones. 
They also reported that Neptune missiles were used in an attack on the Novobryanska 750 kV Electrical Substation in Vygonichi, Bryansk Oblast, two days ago. This substation was also hit by long-range UAVs.

Ukrainian volunteers continue to evacuate as many civilians as possible from Kostyantynivka as Russian forces continue to advance. 
This is one of many videos recently published and shows an evacuation from a street less than 1 km from the frontline.
Most/all of the GUR special forces were killed or wounded by Russian FPV drones as they attempted to entrench behind Russian lines.

Based on the geolocations I did of the Russian FPV drone strikes on Ukrainian special forces, and additional analysis of the footage, we can now deduce where the soldiers ran after being dropped off by the helicopter behind Russian lines. 
A group of 11 soldiers were dropped off at the specified point (48.29667, 37.13317) and split off into two groups. 
Five soldiers ran towards the forest next to the O0525 Highway and then towards the gas station on the edge of the industrial zone. Three were hit by a drone strike after being caught in the forest along the way, and the two survivors attempted to make a run for the gas station but were hit by another drone when crossing the fields. 
Six soldiers ran south from the landing spot and split up as they approached the industrial zone. Four ran southwest into the forest towards the substation, but three were hit by a drone. The fourth soldier escaped back to the edge of the forest before also being hit by a drone while hiding under a tree. As for the other two soldiers from this group, they were able to enter the first building of the industrial zone and hid in a room on the ground floor. Three drones then flew in through the windows, with two striking them. 
So, knowing all this info, it seems that all 11 soldiers were killed or wounded in these attacks. Evacuations of any survivors are unlikely due to their presence behind Russian lines, and they will likely be captured by Russian troops.

Based on the geolocations I did of the Russian FPV drone strikes on Ukrainian special forces, and additional analysis of the footage, we can now deduce where the soldiers ran after being dropped off by the helicopter behind Russian lines.   A group of 11 soldiers‚Ä¶
These are the 11 soldiers I identified, which match the numbers seen being dropped off by the helicopter.

Russian forces have captured the village of Yehorivka, Pokrovske direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~182.
Total land area: ~0.85 km¬≤.

Russian forces have captured the hamlet of Kyrpychne, Pokrovske direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast. 
Pre-war population: ~12.
Total land area: ~0.11 km¬≤
I think this puts it well lol
Explosion in Mykolaiv City. Iskander-M strike. A recon drone was operating over the city.

Last night, a larger than usual Russian Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on Ukraine. More than 100 drones took part, striking targets in several different parts of the country.
Targets were hit in the following areas:
Opishnia, Poltava Oblast (gas treatment facility).
Novhorod-Siverskyi, Chernihiv Oblast.
Berezivka, Odesa Oblast.
Zolotonosha, Cherkasy Oblast.
Fastiv, Kyiv Oblast.
Sumy City, Sumy Oblast.
Lozova, Kharkiv Oblast (railway infrastructure). 
Samiilivka, Kharkiv Oblast (railway infrastructure).
Vasylkivka, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast. 
Slovyansk, Donetsk Oblast (something in the Limansky District of the city).  
Media 1 & 2 show fires at the Oposhnya Gas Treatment Facility in Poltava Oblast following a series of Geran strikes (49.9215, 34.6756). Media 3 & 4 show fires burning in Novhorod-Siverskyi, Chernihiv Oblast.

Explosion in Mykolaiv City. Iskander-M strike. A recon drone was operating over the city.

The Iskander-M ballistic missile strike on Mykolaiv City targeted something at/near a gas station on the western edge of the city. The exact target is unknown, but fuel is now leaking from this gas station. 
Coordinates: 46.984584, 31.903812

A Ukrainian long-range UAV struck the "Ring" oil pipeline in Moscow during yesterday's attacks, which is used to transport gasoline, diesel, and aviation fuel. The GUR claims that all three lines of the pipeline were damaged.
EDIT: This was a sabotage operation.

The Iskander-M ballistic missile strike on Mykolaiv City targeted something at/near a gas station on the western edge of the city. The exact target is unknown, but fuel is now leaking from this gas station.   Coordinates: 46.984584, 31.903812

The Mykolaiv OVA confirms my information about the Iskander strike.
The missile was equipped with a cluster warhead. 1 civilian was killed and 15 others were wounded.

GUR chief Budanov was spotted in Pavlohrad, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast earlier today, following reports of him personally ordering the failed special forces operation on northwestern Pokrovsk. 
Coordinates: 48.53583, 35.81944 (72 km from the frontline, 100 km from Pokrovsk).
Ukrainian helicopters are flying in the area of Pokrovsk right now. Russian channels are warning of possible future landings of special forces.
Iskander on Zaporizhzhia
Iskander on Zaporizhzhia
Disappeared. Probably S-300/400 air defence from Crimea. There are Ukrainian UAVs operating over Russian controlled Kherson Oblast right now.
Ukrainian helicopters are flying in the area of Pokrovsk right now. Russian channels are warning of possible future landings of special forces.
A Russian air defence missile was launched from the Avdiivka area towards Druzhkivka, Donetsk Oblast. Possibly related to the Ukrainian helicopter activity.

The Shadow of War: A Long Shot at Control as Ukraine‚Äôs Arms Black Market Goes Global
Ukraine‚Äôs descent into state failure has cemented its status as a sprawling hub of the global arms black market.
 According to Italy‚Äôs il Fatto Quotidiano, citing Ukraine‚Äôs Ministry of Internal Affairs, 491,426 firearms have been stolen or lost since the war began ‚Äî everything from assault rifles and carbines to pistols and grenade launchers. The Ukrainian analytics platform Opendatabot reports the same figures: the registry is updated daily, and over the past year the number has nearly doubled, from about 271,000 in September 2024 to today‚Äôs count.
Ukraine's Deputy Interior Minister, Bohdan Drapiatyi, has acknowledged that ‚Äúbetween two and five million unregistered weapons may be in private hands,‚Äù admitting that ‚Äúit‚Äôs impossible to calculate precisely.‚Äù In other words, this is not speculation ‚Äî it‚Äôs an official estimate recognized by the Ukrainian government itself.
üëâ

Hezbollah Is Rearming Through Syria, And Israel Is Preparing To Escalate 
Hezbollah is restocking rockets, anti-tank guided missiles, and artillery, increasing the chances of renewed conflict with Israel, The Wall Street Journal reported on October 31, citing sources familiar with Israeli and Arab intelligence on the matter.
The sources told the newspaper that Hezbollah is rearming by smuggling weapons through seaports in Lebanon, as well as smuggling routes through Syria, leading Israel to lose patience with the Lebanese government over its commitment to disarm the group.
The Lebanese government from its side passed a message to Israel through mediators asking it to have patience with their efforts to disarm Hezbollah, and said they are open to expanding cooperation on the matter, according to the sources.
üëâ

Trump Rules Out Strikes Against Venezuela, But Everything Else Suggest Attack Is Imminent
President Donald Trump on October 31 denied that the United States was considering strikes against targets linked to drug cartels inside Venezuela.
When asked by reporters if recent media reports that he was considering strikes within Venezuela were true, Trump said, ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù
Last August, the Trump administration doubled the reward for the arrest of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro to $50 million on drug trafficking charges then deployed an amphibious ready group with thousands of marines close to the country‚Äôs shores on a so-called ‚Äúcounter narco-terror operation‚Äù.
Tensions mounted in recent days with the U.S. sending its bombers near the country‚Äôs coast three times and ordering the deployment of an entire carrier strike group to the Caribbean Sea.
üëâ

A Losing Strategy: How Kyiv's Attacks Prompt Russia's Overwhelming Response
On October 30-31, Russia and Ukraine continued their exchange of strikes. According to the Russian Ministry of Defense, its armed forces conducted one massive and five group strikes over the week, employing long-range high-precision weapons and attack UAVs. The reported targets included "Flamingo" missile production facilities, military-industrial sites, energy and transportation infrastructure, airfields, as well as deployment points of Ukrainian armed forces and foreign mercenaries.
Regarding recent Ukrainian strikes on Russian oil refineries, American political scientist Nikolai Petro, analyzing this strategy, characterized it as inherently losing. Petro pointed out that while the attacks indeed cause damage and reduce revenue, Russia possesses sufficient financial reserves to withstand these losses for several years.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

Ukraine To Lose Uspenovka: Russian Forces Engage In Fierce Urban Battle¬†
The Russian Armed Forces have imposed fire control over the road to Zvanovka, south of Seversk. Units of the ¬´East¬ª grouping have taken control of Novoaleksandrovka. Russian forces have seized the 'Matrona of Moscow' mine in the Konstantinovka sector. 
The conflict in Ukraine poses a threat to the US dollar's status as the world's reserve currency.
